sentences.english: I , said the Beetle , With my thread and needle, I'll make the shroud.
sentences.chinese: 甲虫说，是我，用我的针和线，我会来做寿衣。

sentences.english: Who'll make his shroud? "I, " said the beetle.
sentences.chinese: 谁来做寿衣？是我，甲虫说。

sentences.english: Whiter is my true love's shroud.
sentences.chinese: 比我爱人的寿衣还素白。

sentences.english: Then, dressed in the proper burial clothes at home, the endotube was removed and Ambu bag discontinued.
sentences.chinese: 回到家后，穿上寿衣后，拔掉气管，停止呼吸辅助袋。

sentences.english: Ill buy my love some flannel, Ill make my love a shroud.
sentences.chinese: 我买来法兰绒，给我的可爱做寿衣。

sentences.english: They wore shrouds and were often described as bloated and of ruddy or dark countenance.
sentences.chinese: 他们穿寿衣，但往往被臃肿和红润或暗的脸上描述。
寿衣上没有裁制装钱的口袋。

sentences.english: All of the corpses wrapped in white shrouds .
sentences.chinese: 个个尸体都披着白色的寿衣。

sentences.english: With my thread and needle. I'll make his shroud.
sentences.chinese: 我将为他做寿衣，用我的针和线。

sentences.english: With my thread and needle, I'll make the shroud.
sentences.chinese: 用我的针和线，我将为他做寿衣。

definition: to put dead body in coffin
to wear mourning clothes/to be in mourning/also written 披麻帶孝|披麻带孝
to wear mourning garb/to be in mourning
bier/bed kept as it was when the deceased was alive
